NzBzSMGlTWNqtIZJK7DryQ.text: Ok, so I try to write balanced feedback as if it were a performance review, but Locale makes it hard.  Two nights ago they broke every customer service rule there is, and the food isn't close to good enough to make their bad attitudes ok. First impression at the door..hostess looked up at me but did not greet or acknowledge me. She walked away..then came back, as I'm about to walk out she asks how can she help. I ask for a table and am told it will be 30 minutes even though there are 5-6 empty tables and only one group waiting in the bar. BTW..its 9ish on a tuesday not exactly the busiest time.  I have a seat at the mostly empty bar and both bartenders take turns looking at me but not serving me. Finally the first bartender asks if I'm ok and i look at the empty bar space in front of me and say "no, I'd like a beer. Moretti please". He walks into the kitchen and does not return. 5 minutes later the other bartender asks if I need something and I said yes..I'd like the beer I ordered five minutes ago. I sipped the beer and watched the chef yell at another hostess in full view of customers.  Now..I'm torn at this point because the service IS pretty bad but you don't scream at employees in front of customers..EVER. I consider walking out again but have a half beer so I wait. Finally I get a table. Server barely speaks English and bumps into me every time she comes and goes from the table. The caprese has almost no basil, the pasta is not fresh, the tomato sauce is watery, some of the shellfish has not opened (ie...dead).  The food isn't terrible but is not good either.  Not a single smile from anyone the entire time. Do yourself a favor..skip Locale. There are plenty of rude waiters at other restaurants in London who at least serve good food.

6d3qMbzCdegSbNgtckW-Qg.text: This isn't a bad place at all. It's not cheap. You can't buy a pint of beer here but you can spend £5.00 on a bottle that is the size of a pint or thereabouts. The crowd is mostly made up of nearby media people. That's why I have been there so often and know it pretty well. It gets pretty noisy and fills up with the smell of fried food around 7pm. Usually calimari. It's an OK place to fall into if you are working or wandering nearby but it is a transient place and not somewhere you would get all dolled up and go to at the weekend. If you are looking for a job in the media then you should go here and eavesdrop and wear a sandwich board saying you want to work in TV and hand out your CV as people pass in and out of the unisex toilets. Just make sure you don't hand it to the staff from St. Thomas' Hospital though as that won't help you get a job in tele. Oh and why people throw toilet paper onto the floor when there are bins is beyond me. Must be something to do with unisexuals.

vJhrwH7RK355VBYJ6NhcNg.text: Delicious! Great service! Wine list has a lot to choose from. Try the minestrone soup and the spinach ravioli with tomato sauce. Very, very good. We would have preferred more sauce, but that's just us. All around us, the desserts looked good but we were too full to eat one more bite. After a long day of sight seeing, stopping here for a late evening meal was the right choice for that day!

LdkLMidn-75xGPl5kVC0wg.text: We had a few glasses of very nice wine in this place which were very enjoyable. We didnt eat in the restaurant but had the bar food. Salumi, una pizza quattro stagioni e zucchini fritti. It was very nice, especially the zucchini fritti, but what really made this place were the staff. I dont think I have ever come across a more freindly and welcoming place. The bar staff came and chatted to us and everyone was genuinely freindly, without it feeling forced or fake. I really loved it and for a Saturday night it was nice and quiet in the bar. This is a real hidden gem I'm loathed to tell anyone about it but in all honesty they deserve the praise, I would rate it a 4.5 stars but since I cant they definately deserve a 5* rating. Grazie mille Locale, ciao e arrivederci

efydIhNG2QhW4ch0dWsv1g.text: Locale was a last-minute choice for us, as it was close to the Marriott County Hall and in the middle of a downpour anywhere close was preferable! The first thing that struck us as we walked in was the wonderful aroma of freshly-grilled beef. The kitchen is a long, thin slice of the restaurant, and is open to view from the dining area. The restaurant itself is quite stylish, with beautiful looking, waif-thin waiting staff of both genders. Service itself was reasonably quick and efficient. However, the food itself was a mix in terms of quality. As starters, Gerry chose the Calamari, and I went for the Salude Miste - a mix of Italian cold meats served on Sardinian flatbread with tomato salsa and shaved fennel. The calamari was pretty generic, tasting like it was pre-purchased (and not a patch on that at Ha-Noi Cafe in Abingdon) and as for the Salude Miste - sadly, that was a triumph of style over substance, with the meats lacking flavour and the bread dry and dull. However, the meal was rescued by the main courses. My pizza Frutti Di Mare had a wonderful crisp base, and a fantastic tomato and basil sauce with the fresh basil shining through. The seafood was fresh-tasting and lively, while the capers were thankfully not over-used! Gerry's dish - short, thick pasta with an italian sausage ragu was tasty and a far cry from a usual bolognese sauce. We had other things to do, so we skipped dessert - and this was probably a good thing, as the two courses with a couple of glasses of wine was a total of £58 including the (already added) 12.5% service charge. Overall, this was a reasonable meal, with nothing that really provoked complaint - but if you are going to spend £30/head on two courses, even in London, you can do much better.

tmiALs7Dqp2V7wd_DD4SYA.text: I was very disappointed with the "risotto" which was not what I expected and most certainly not a risotto. Starting with the fact that it wasn't risotto but long grain rice, it had been cooked in water and two mushrooms cut up into it, and cooked a little more. The dish was absolutely tasteless, overcooked, and watery. The service was very friendly and nice. My friend's pizzas looked good; the lasagne has been judged as ok.

2ujCpKPWMxup-ijg4XymwQ.text: I ordered the linguine with seafood and next day I am sick for two days. Food poisoning? I think so. So much for my LONDON vacation.

mvqrU_tUy8Dkeg-TNd3QOQ.text: Great location in downtown London. 3 minute walk from Big Ben. I checked in and was surprised to find we got a free beer. I had the lasagna and it was top notch. April had the risotto and it was equally great. Definitely recommended to get some carbs for walking around London all day. 5 out of 5.

iDenmMShFDUxq5qy_Za9lA.text: This place was fantastic! Friendly and attentive server, food was wonderful. We had the ravioli, lamb, and lasagne as well as the burrata appetizer.  Everything was perfect, flavorful, meat tender, and food perfectly cooked.

A5xHxrzEM8IrqsqXJdGdJA.text: Delicious food, friendly staff, authentic Italian Cuisine! We tried their Pizza, Pasta and main course. Eating Italian outside Italy can sometimes be a huge let down, this spot held its own! Delicious from beginning to end. Ciao!!

Koj4vb9DOkmxSB4xrfUOGw.text: Good authentic Italian that pleased the entire family.  The lasagne was creamy and delicious, and other pasta dishes delighted.  The filetto of beef was less successful but might have seemed tough because there was no steak knife provided and so had to make do with the butter knife.Absolutely must get the pizza bread with mozzarella as a starter.  It's fabulous!  Pass on the focaccia as its a bit dry even with olive oil drizzle.Service is with a smile but could have been more attentive.  Prices were fair especially near tourist area.

VxvI7-P64R7-4hzpQc_1Fg.text: Congrats! You did it... officially never eating steak again after your Filletto de Manzo moo'd at me last night. This place was truly a disaster and I have never been so MISLED in my life. I found your restaurant with "London Eye views" on Trip Advisor when planning my short stay in London. I didn't realize London Eye views translated to Marriott scaffolding. My family and I were willing to overlook this disappointment as the menu appeared to look legitimate. We started with "Rosemary Focaccia" (sour dough bread smothered in jarred pesto) & Burrata (served with Mexican tortilla chips?). Once again we were willing to overlook this as our entrees sounded delicious. Gnocchi al Gamberetti (described as in a white wine & garlic sauce with crayfish) & Filetto de Manzo. Wow was my sister surprised when her gnocchi came out in a jarred red sauce with "crayfish" that looked like cockroaches. The grand finale was the raw steak served over instant mash potatoes. I hope no one else ruins one of their 4 meals in London on this place. Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of Locale - London, United Kingdom. Mexican taco shells served with Burrata cheese?

JxaaxajV8b8mAcipvJYQiw.text: Its New Years Eve  and my partner and i had been to two other places to have a drink, we then found Locale  near to the London Eye (we came to watch  the fireworks at midnight) this place although busy had a place to sit down and have a drink while we were waiting. The  doorman come bouncers  did'nt look friendly the prices were pretty expensive on the drinks which quickly emptied you wallet, but the staff were friendly and helpful. Very basic decor and this place was also a resturant which was funny because although this place was very busy and people wanting to have a table ,half the tables were empty but they were being told there was a waiting time.Would not recommend this place unless you have money to throw away or desperate.

photos.caption: Photo of Locale - London, United Kingdom

4TvFTmL2uYsvT61CcBDp8A.text: We had a late lunch here.  All three of us ordered pizzas and we were very happy with them.  We had just come from Italy on an earlier leg of our vacation and worried we'd be holding this place to too a standard.  The pizza was great, the toppings fresh and the wait staff was friendly and responsive.  There is a 12.5% service charge, but we are used to tipping 20% at home, so this seemed well earned.

TZuhrpwwUHK7Wec-0KP6aQ.text: It's funny to read the other reviews because hubs and I loved our lunch at Locale. We were overtired, having walked way too far on no breakfast or snack and it was nearly two p.m. by the time we agreed on Locale. Cute little place, really friendly staff who seated us right away.We loved our waiter, who bantered with us the entire time. I had the lasagna and hubs the wild boar ragu. Both dishes were amazing. I would come back here in a heartbeat.

HlA4_5Qq5jK_dbtEbSxU3g.text: We had a fantastic meal. They seated us well before the initial time they quoted me. The kid pizza was enormous. I had the decadent dish with pancetta, cream and eggs. My husband both loved the fresh pasta in our dishes. My daughters calzone was great too. The cheesecake, gelato and tiramisu were great. Lots of leftovers too.

tpyZcxnz_TQNd5KjDzwCIg.text: Another great discovery by our County Hall hotel.  This restaurant has authentic Italian cuisine.  We had an Italian sausage pizza which was amazing and pasta.  Every dish that came out looked delicious. We had great service from a wonderful young man from Sicily.  He anticipated our every need. Wonderful.

TH1Yj8GUpan6hI0lTazg8A.text: Found this place as I was walking back to my hotel room.  The food and the atmosphere was great.  I will definitely be back from dinner before I head back to the USA.

4sF2wdTdMGgOiFouHmwaEg.text: Food was above average, it's conveniently located near major London attractions. I recommend this place for an enjoyable lunch.

Eup0Di7lHnVDQxhw2dkT-g.text: It is a good location if you are looking for something quick, decent, and have to contend with a teenager (like what teenager doesn't eat Italian food?)  It's close to the Eye and other attractions and busy enough.  Waitstaff is hard working.  There are so many places in London to eat, don't know if I would make a special trip to go back but at least you know it's a good back-up.  I'm torn between 3 or 4 stars - it was okay leaning towards 4 stars though.

t129Ou2U70mklHzm0-nAKQ.text: The Gnocchi was gorgeous! do not get me wrong. It tasted really fresh and also the ingriedients seemed pure! But what kind of italian restaurant doesn'r seve cheesecake for dessert?? crazy or what!! Also the service wasn't quick enough, for a busy saturday night there didn't seem to be anywhere near enough staff!

gaPOWNlUVtqqxc_yyklJ2A.text: I am from out of town and went to this place last night.  Food is decent, nothing remarkable at all.  The service is just so bad. I don't know why you would hire a waitress that can't remember 2 things at once.  #StayAwayWorst marketing program: Bonus Happy Hour

XWYUvaAH1lc8dO5h2vRLSQ.text: Locale restaurant and cocktail bar is just moments from the London aquarium and Waterloo station. The spacious restaurant area is ideal for all diners, from couples to families, solo diners to groups, the restaurant has an open kitchen at its centre, with comfortable leather booth seating. With the close proximity to the London aquarium, Locale is a popular location for tourists, who can book packages for a meal. The restaurant also has a beautiful cocktail lounge area for up to 50 people. The fresh fruit cocktails are perfect for after work drinks or celebrating a special event. Guests can enjoy also stuzzichini  small Italian dishes that are perfect to accompany both the cocktails and delicious wines on offer. A terrace space for forty guests is perfect for alfresco dining. Diners can gaze on the architectural splendour of County Hall whilst enjoying a terrific meal.Locale bar is the destination for both tourists and locals to go to if they want great Italian food in South Bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Locale - London, United Kingdom

FzOcYJ-7wVv1RiGAr9JMrw.text: For being a slightly over priced franchised restaurant, Locale is not bad.  I have enjoyed all of their beef dishes.  The establishment has also been consistent over the years.

1tNcjiU3sE8b6FEeRxx2ww.text: This restaurant stroke Bar was pretty run of Mill sort of  a restaurant  that you can find out the heart  of London's capital,  and the restaurant decor was okay nothing to fancy that you could say that stood out or that I'd remembered but there was slight poshess to it only just slight though, I did find the barman was polite enough in showing me the ranges of beers that they had in stock. Mind you drinks in there were definately  a tad pointing to the steep side on the ole pocket.This place in general I had stumbled across and on the whole it did get quite packed but not overly  and the food again looked kinda poshly presented  but I did not try any on this ocassion. Atmosphere wise  the bar seemed friendly enough.I wouldn't say I was overly blown away by this place but then again it wasn't terrible. just wouldn't go out my way to go there but fine if your in that neck of the city looking for a quick one drink and move on I guess.

dKoEPWOjs3Y81akuouUITg.text: This restaurant is located right across the bridge from Parliament and Westminster Abby. Great location!I did not have a reservation but the restaurant was able to accommodate me. The decor was not anything special to talk about. I did not like the candle on the table. Was a bit of a fire hazard. The food was unbelievably delicious! I wanted the vegetable lasagna but the restaurant was out. I got the vegetarian ravioli instead. It was delicious. The ravioli was made in the restaurant by hand. The best Italian I have had in London.Overall I think this is a must see in London.

MMuk9UlYGggxhuTl8m9RIg.text: Stay away from the pizza or calzones!  Neither was notable other the lack of ricotta in the calzone and that the cheese used did not completely melt.  Oh. The calzone also had a strange fishy taste, which for ham was a bit off. On the positives, the bar staff was entertaining. Between some very demanding and peculiar customers ("No!  My lime must be twisted the other way!!  *turns it over* and "I don't care what the bottle says...that isn't the right whiskey") their attempts at Tom Cruise's "Cocktail" moves were a miss but the loose ice cube became a "GOOOOAAALLL!!!" Not to be missed. And I enjoyed the Italian lager, Peroni (part of a Yelp deal). I'm sure the regular Italian food would have been good - make reservations else you will be relegated to the bar and not worthy pizza and calzone. Overall, prices seemed reasonable (especially for this tourist part of London), but if you want pizza, there are other places must rank higher despite this place being voted one of London's top 10 Italian restaurants in 2017.

QM4K1rP9P9Z2RSLB4yNJRQ.text: First was seated and took our server 20 minutes to get our Drink order.  Then did place our drink and food order at the same time no time to ask for a small plate.  When order finally arrived steak which was ordered rare came out Medium Well at best sent back and got a calzone which was ok but not what I wanted.  Then realized someone in my party ordered a medium well fillet and got theirs rare.  Waiter screwed up meal not what was wanted or expected no remorse from waiter.

UPkwHS2lddRfwElRZlFJtQ.text: The service was excellent. Very pleasant atmosphere, and confronting food. Would recommend to visit, right next to the Big Ben.

photos.caption: Photo of Locale - London, United Kingdom. Very filling food.
Photo of Locale - London, United Kingdom. Cutest dessert

7YpQPcL2HcRUetmxkHbQ4Q.text: After walking all morning we came here for lunch. I ordered the margarita pizza which came without any basil, so it was pretty plain. Happily our waiter brought me some fresh basil. My hubs had the ravioli and it was also pretty plain. But neither meal was too expensive. The service was good and the atmosphere was fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Locale - London, United Kingdom. Margarita pizza
Photo of Locale - London, United Kingdom. Fresh Ravioli

WGcpivhn0XTk2Lts4du7cw.text: I got the vegetable pizza with no cheese so it is vegan. Their sauce could definitely use more spice because it is very bland. Also could add more sauce to the pizza.

9JQRsoRRIy8y26k6KLjprw.text: After a long day seeing the sights in London, the fam looked forward to a nice meal.  The restaurant had nice decor.  I had chicken with mushrooms and cherry tomatoes. Wife and daughter had the pizza.  Food and service was decent. Why the three stars?  While service was decent, the waiter really seemed high on himself. He never came by to see if we were ok. He seemed really put out when we wanted to settle our bill. We must have bothered his conversation with the other waitress.If your an American, try someplace else!  Probably better service and better food.

KxC9ine5gZQkh-SP2ulvsQ.text: We visited on a Tuesday evening. They told us it would be a 45 minute wait, but ended up only waiting 10 minutes. The waiter didn't take our drink order for about 15 minutes, but once the order was placed we only waited about 15 minutes for the food to arrive. The waiter made great suggestions for additions to our order. We ordered the Bucatini, garlic bread pizza, and vegetable lasagna. It was all very delicious and we loved it!

wryl7XSGoHnIjXgyJp6vVQ.text: When you're on vacation with the family and staying in a tourist intensive are restaurants can be tough. It's all too easy to pay far too much for too little served by surly restaurateurs who know they will never see you again. Locale had none of this. Simply put, after a long day of seeing the sights we had a great, reasonably priced meal right around the corner from our hotel. Service was excellent, the pasta was fresh, and the salads were refreshing. All in all a wonderful experience that I can highly recommend.

OtkrZGa95-5fvO0StZ5z5Q.text: We went to Locale not expecting that much, after all it's just Italian... we ended up having such a simple but oh so tasty meal. We used up all the pizza crust to get the leftover sauce from each other's plates! We're a family of five and it felt great... Calamari was deliciously crunchy, my Seafood linguine was perfect, so fresh and not too sour. Every meal had a deep flavor, because they use house made tomato sauce. Kids loved their pizza, breaded chicken on pasta and meatballs. I'd say for a nice place like that, kids meals were very well priced and portioned. To top it all off, the waiters were just genuinely nice, even though they were extremely busy. Great place, I'd go there with family or just for a couples dinner again for sure!

Xx3tHomZw8gRy1cl9_9vbg.text: Nice food but it does take a while for even starters to come. The main dishes were good the pizza were a bit western style, I was hoping for a more euro style nice and thin. The spaghetti was nice though.

5Re8AiFevSG0QiUP6iPuTQ.text: The food was good not great just ok. The waitress seemed a bit standoffish and not super friendly. The drinks were great though and the female bartender (sorry I don't know her name) was fantastic, and personable.

ct2H0SK7l52MWp4GgyZwsQ.text: We got take away from Locale and it didn't disappoint! I imagine it would've been even better dining in. The bucatini was a highlight for me,  the flavors were delicious! We also ordered the mussels appetizer, which was so good in the creamy white wine sauce. Thinking about coming back tonight!

loKCCzQk1F6X7VZ71WPBEw.text: Hotel told us about this place and it doesn't disappoint. The food and service was amazing. We ate here twice during our trip. We had 7 in our party and all tried different things each time. We did not have a dish we did not like or would not order again. Great Italian in London. A must try for wonderful pasta or pizza.

NawQHuPv8VJLcFPqBKofxg.text: Currently on vacation , was hungry this restaurant caught my attention. Simply because it was close to London eye and plenty of ppl eating over. I didn't like the fact that there were ppl smoking at the entrance of the restaurant, literally in front, it wasn't pleasant. Good part was, I got seated right away, unfortunately they don't serve free water, like tap water, you have to pay for tap water. Over all the food was good and the people were nice.

wCaeugto-764VbKuOSjJGA.text: Went to dinner here while in London. Locale was busy, but we were seated right away inside. We ordered two pasta dishes. The food was ok, but the reason for the one star was service. Our food took 1 hour and 10 minutes for us to receive. During that time the waiter only check on us once. After waiting 30-40 minutes and noticing people who where seated after us getting their food the waiter advised  a large order was placed before us and we should be getting our food shortly. This didn't make sense since every one else was getting food they ordered after us. The waiter was going to get us more water, but never came back. They did end up taking 2 of our drinks off after we had asked. The waiter should of been honest and checked on us more often.

DxoAWKTKO-OAH5DnuRfdQg.text: I had the Lasagna, and my wife had the Ravioli (vegetable with butter sage sauce). Both were fantastic, and pair well with their wine list. I will be recommending to all of my family in friends back in the States.

PjaNc_f7NavLon7bCo0ILg.text: Rashad was our waiter and he was fabulous! He gave Oli's outstanding service. The food was incredibly good. My family is fromItaly and finding authentic and fresh Italian food isn't easy. Locale has an array of delicious foods on the menu. We dined there twice during a visit to London. Reservations are a must! The carbonara is deliciously prepared, the cappuccino isPerfect and the tiramisu is to dye for.

ywAPHum_uyKoSabMtPVeWA.text: Great food and service. Very busy but food was brought out quickly and was great! Perfect location by the London Eye/South bank. Very close to Marriott hotel.

0P9LSfFCBTUUIUwtpZgTVA.text: This is a good spot if you're in the area and want something simple and convenient, otherwise you can do better. The pappardelle with spicy lamb ragu was just ok (definitely not spicy) and the superfood salad was somewhat bland. They do mix a great cocktail though. And the staff was nice, and attentive but not overbearing. Keep an eye out for the 12.5% service charge added to the bill.
